info.title: Ethereum JSON-RPC
info.description: This API lets you interact with an EVM-based client via JSON-RPC

methods.name: admin_addPeer
methods.summary:
AddPeer requests connecting to a remote node, and also maintaining the new
connection at all times, even reconnecting if it is lost.

methods.name: admin_addTrustedPeer
methods.summary: AddTrustedPeer allows a remote node to always connect, even if slots are full

methods.name: admin_datadir
methods.summary: Datadir retrieves the current data directory the node is using.

methods.name: admin_exportChain
methods.summary:
ExportChain exports the current blockchain into a local file,
or a range of blocks if first and last are non-nil

methods.name: admin_importChain
methods.summary: ImportChain imports a blockchain from a local file.

methods.name: admin_nodeInfo
methods.summary:
NodeInfo retrieves all the information we know about the host node at the
protocol granularity.

methods.name: admin_peerEvents
methods.summary:
PeerEvents creates an RPC subscription which receives peer events from the
node's p2p.Server

methods.name: admin_peers
methods.summary:
Peers retrieves all the information we know about each individual peer at the
protocol granularity.

methods.name: admin_removePeer
methods.summary: RemovePeer disconnects from a remote node if the connection exists

methods.name: admin_removeTrustedPeer
methods.summary:
RemoveTrustedPeer removes a remote node from the trusted peer set, but it
does not disconnect it automatically.

methods.name: admin_startRPC
methods.summary: StartRPC starts the HTTP RPC API server.

methods.name: admin_startWS
methods.summary: StartWS starts the websocket RPC API server.

methods.name: admin_stopRPC
methods.summary: StopRPC terminates an already running HTTP RPC API endpoint.

methods.name: admin_stopWS
methods.summary: StopWS terminates an already running websocket RPC API endpoint.

methods.name: debug_accountRange
methods.summary: AccountRange enumerates all accounts in the latest state

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash POINTER
oneOf.title: keccak

.*.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash POINTER
.*.title: keccak

methods.name: debug_backtraceAt
methods.summary:
BacktraceAt sets the log backtrace location. See package log for details on
the pattern syntax.

methods.name: debug_blockProfile
methods.summary:
BlockProfile turns on goroutine profiling for nsec seconds and writes profile data to
file. It uses a profile rate of 1 for most accurate information. If a different rate is
desired, set the rate and write the profile manually.

methods.name: debug_chaindbCompact
methods.summary:
ChaindbCompact flattens the entire key-value database into a single level,
removing all unused slots and merging all keys.

methods.name: debug_chaindbProperty
methods.summary: ChaindbProperty returns leveldb properties of the key-value database.

methods.name: debug_cpuProfile
methods.summary:
CpuProfile turns on CPU profiling for nsec seconds and writes
profile data to file.

methods.name: debug_dumpBlock
methods.summary: DumpBlock retrieves the entire state of the database at a given block.

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
oneOf.title: keccak

methods.name: debug_freeOSMemory
methods.summary: FreeOSMemory returns unused memory to the OS.

methods.name: debug_gcStats
methods.summary: GcStats returns GC statistics.

methods.name: debug_getBadBlocks
methods.summary:
GetBadBlocks returns a list of the last 'bad blocks' that the client has seen on the network
and returns them as a JSON list of block-hashes

methods.name: debug_getBlockRlp
methods.summary: GetBlockRlp retrieves the RLP encoded for of a single block.

methods.name: debug_getModifiedAccountsByHash
methods.summary:
GetModifiedAccountsByHash returns all accounts that have changed between the
two blocks specified. A change is defined as a difference in nonce, balance,
code hash, or storage hash.

With one parameter, returns the list of accounts modified in the specified block.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash POINTER
oneOf.title: keccak

methods.name: debug_getModifiedAccountsByNumber
methods.summary:
GetModifiedAccountsByNumber returns all accounts that have changed between the
two blocks specified. A change is defined as a difference in nonce, balance,
code hash, or storage hash.

With one parameter, returns the list of accounts modified in the specified block.

methods.name: debug_goTrace
methods.summary:
GoTrace turns on tracing for nsec seconds and writes
trace data to file.

methods.name: debug_memStats
methods.summary: MemStats returns detailed runtime memory statistics.

methods.name: debug_mutexProfile
methods.summary:
MutexProfile turns on mutex profiling for nsec seconds and writes profile data to file.
It uses a profile rate of 1 for most accurate information. If a different rate is
desired, set the rate and write the profile manually.

methods.name: debug_preimage
methods.summary: Preimage is a debug API function that returns the preimage for a sha3 hash, if known.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a 256 bit unit of data
oneOf.title: dataWord

methods.name: debug_printBlock
methods.summary: PrintBlock retrieves a block and returns its pretty printed form.

methods.name: debug_seedHash
methods.summary: SeedHash retrieves the seed hash of a block.

methods.name: debug_setBlockProfileRate
methods.summary:
SetBlockProfileRate sets the rate of goroutine block profile data collection.
rate 0 disables block profiling.

methods.name: debug_setGCPercent
methods.summary:
SetGCPercent sets the garbage collection target percentage. It returns the previous
setting. A negative value disables GC.

methods.name: debug_setHead
methods.summary: SetHead rewinds the head of the blockchain to a previous block.

methods.name: debug_setMutexProfileFraction
methods.summary: SetMutexProfileFraction sets the rate of mutex profiling.

methods.name: debug_stacks
methods.summary: Stacks returns a printed representation of the stacks of all goroutines.

methods.name: debug_standardTraceBadBlockToFile
methods.summary:
StandardTraceBadBlockToFile dumps the structured logs created during the
execution of EVM against a block pulled from the pool of bad ones to the
local file system and returns a list of files to the caller.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: debug_standardTraceBlockToFile
methods.summary:
StandardTraceBlockToFile dumps the structured logs created during the
execution of EVM to the local file system and returns a list of files
to the caller.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: debug_startCPUProfile
methods.summary: StartCPUProfile turns on CPU profiling, writing to the given file.

methods.name: debug_startGoTrace
methods.summary: StartGoTrace turns on tracing, writing to the given file.

methods.name: debug_stopCPUProfile
methods.summary: StopCPUProfile stops an ongoing CPU profile.

methods.name: debug_stopGoTrace
methods.summary: StopTrace stops an ongoing trace.

methods.name: debug_storageRangeAt
methods.summary: StorageRangeAt returns the storage at the given block height and transaction index.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a 256 bit unit of data
oneOf.title: dataWord

methods.name: debug_testSignCliqueBlock
methods.summary:
TestSignCliqueBlock fetches the given block number, and attempts to sign it as a clique header with the
given address, returning the address of the recovered signature

This is a temporary method to debug the externalsigner integration,
TODO: Remove this method when the integration is mature

methods.name: debug_traceBadBlock
methods.summary:
TraceBadBlockByHash returns the structured logs created during the execution of
EVM against a block pulled from the pool of bad ones and returns them as a JSON
object.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: debug_traceBlock
methods.summary:
TraceBlock returns the structured logs created during the execution of EVM
and returns them as a JSON object.

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a variable length byte array
oneOf.title: bytes

methods.name: debug_traceBlockByHash
methods.summary:
TraceBlockByHash returns the structured logs created during the execution of
EVM and returns them as a JSON object.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: debug_traceBlockByNumber
methods.summary:
TraceBlockByNumber returns the structured logs created during the execution of
EVM and returns them as a JSON object.

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
oneOf.title: keccak

methods.name: debug_traceBlockFromFile
methods.summary:
TraceBlockFromFile returns the structured logs created during the execution of
EVM and returns them as a JSON object.

methods.name: debug_traceChain
methods.summary:
TraceChain returns the structured logs created during the execution of EVM
between two blocks (excluding start) and returns them as a JSON object.

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash

methods.name: debug_traceTransaction
methods.summary:
FIXME: Is this really supposed to return an *ethapi.ExecutionResult type, or the empty interface in case not *vm.StructLogger?
TraceTransaction returns the structured logs created during the execution of EVM
and returns them as a JSON object.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: debug_verbosity
methods.summary:
Verbosity sets the log verbosity ceiling. The verbosity of individual packages
and source files can be raised using Vmodule.

methods.name: debug_vmodule
methods.summary:
Vmodule sets the log verbosity pattern. See package log for details on the
pattern syntax.

methods.name: debug_writeBlockProfile
methods.summary: WriteBlockProfile writes a goroutine blocking profile to the given file.

methods.name: debug_writeMemProfile
methods.summary:
WriteMemProfile writes an allocation profile to the given file.
Note that the profiling rate cannot be set through the API,
it must be set on the command line.

methods.name: debug_writeMutexProfile
methods.summary: WriteMutexProfile writes a goroutine blocking profile to the given file.

methods.name: eth_accounts
methods.summary: Accounts returns the collection of accounts this node manages

methods.name: eth_blockNumber
methods.summary: BlockNumber returns the block number of the chain head.

methods.name: eth_call
methods.summary:
Call executes the given transaction on the state for the given block number.

Additionally, the caller can specify a batch of contract for fields overriding.

Note, this function doesn't make and changes in the state/blockchain and is
useful to execute and retrieve values.

methods.name: eth_chainId
methods.summary: ChainId is the EIP-155 replay-protection chain id for the current ethereum chain config.

methods.name: eth_chainId
methods.summary: ChainId returns the chainID value for transaction replay protection.

methods.name: eth_coinbase
methods.summary: Coinbase is the address that mining rewards will be send to (alias for Etherbase)

methods.name: eth_estimateGas
methods.summary:
EstimateGas returns an estimate of the amount of gas needed to execute the
given transaction against the current pending block.

methods.name: eth_etherbase
methods.summary: Etherbase is the address that mining rewards will be send to

methods.name: eth_fillTransaction
methods.summary:
FillTransaction fills the defaults (nonce, gas, gasPrice) on a given unsigned transaction,
and returns it to the caller for further processing (signing + broadcast)

methods.name: eth_gasPrice
methods.summary: GasPrice returns a suggestion for a gas price.

methods.name: eth_getBalance
methods.summary:
GetBalance returns the amount of wei for the given address in the state of the
given block number. The rpc.LatestBlockNumber and rpc.PendingBlockNumber meta
block numbers are also allowed.

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
oneOf.title: keccak

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
oneOf.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_getBlockByHash
methods.summary:
GetBlockByHash returns the requested block. When fullTx is true all transactions in the block are returned in full
detail, otherwise only the transaction hash is returned.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_getBlockByNumber
methods.summary:
GetBlockByNumber returns the requested canonical block.
* When blockNr is -1 the chain head is returned.
* When blockNr is -2 the pending chain head is returned.
* When fullTx is true all transactions in the block are returned, otherwise
  only the transaction hash is returned.

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
oneOf.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByHash
methods.summary: GetBlockTransactionCountByHash returns the number of transactions in the block with the given hash.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_getBlockTransactionCountByNumber
methods.summary: GetBlockTransactionCountByNumber returns the number of transactions in the block with the given block number.

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
oneOf.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_getCode
methods.summary: GetCode returns the code stored at the given address in the state for the given block number.

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash

methods.name: eth_getFilterChanges
methods.summary:
GetFilterChanges returns the logs for the filter with the given id since
last time it was called. This can be used for polling.

For pending transaction and block filters the result is []common.Hash.
(pending)Log filters return []Log.

https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_getfilterchanges

methods.name: eth_getFilterLogs
methods.summary:
GetFilterLogs returns the logs for the filter with the given id.
If the filter could not be found an empty array of logs is returned.

https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_getfilterlogs

items.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash

methods.name: eth_getHashrate
methods.summary: GetHashrate returns the current hashrate for local CPU miner and remote miner.

methods.name: eth_getHeaderByHash

methods.name: eth_getHeaderByNumber
methods.summary:
GetHeaderByNumber returns the requested canonical block header.
* When blockNr is -1 the chain head is returned.
* When blockNr is -2 the pending chain head is returned.

GetLogs returns logs matching the given argument that are stored within the state.

all transactions in the block are returned in full detail, otherwise only the transaction hash is returned.

methods.name: eth_getWork
methods.summary:
GetWork returns a work package for external miner.

The work package consists of 3 strings:
  result[0] - 32 bytes hex encoded current block header pow-hash
  result[1] - 32 bytes hex encoded seed hash used for DAG
  result[2] - 32 bytes hex encoded boundary condition ("target"), 2^256/difficulty
  result[3] - hex encoded block number

methods.name: eth_hashrate
methods.summary: Hashrate returns the POW hashrate

methods.name: eth_logs
methods.summary: Logs creates a subscription that fires for all new log that match the given filter criteria.

items.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
items.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_mining
methods.summary: Mining returns an indication if this node is currently mining.

methods.name: eth_newBlockFilter
methods.summary:
NewBlockFilter creates a filter that fetches blocks that are imported into the chain.
It is part of the filter package since polling goes with eth_getFilterChanges.

https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_newblockfilter

methods.name: eth_newFilter
methods.summary:
NewFilter creates a new filter and returns the filter id. It can be
used to retrieve logs when the state changes. This method cannot be
used to fetch logs that are already stored in the state.

Default criteria for the from and to block are "latest".
Using "latest" as block number will return logs for mined blocks.
Using "pending" as block number returns logs for not yet mined (pending) blocks.
In case logs are removed (chain reorg) previously returned logs are returned
again but with the removed property set to true.

In case "fromBlock" > "toBlock" an error is returned.

https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_newfilter

items.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
items.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_newHeads
methods.summary: NewHeads send a notification each time a new (header) block is appended to the chain.

methods.name: eth_newPendingTransactionFilter
methods.summary:
NewPendingTransactionFilter creates a filter that fetches pending transaction hashes
as transactions enter the pending state.

It is part of the filter package because this filter can be used through the
`eth_getFilterChanges` polling method that is also used for log filters.

https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_newpendingtransactionfilter

methods.name: eth_newPendingTransactions
methods.summary:
NewPendingTransactions creates a subscription that is triggered each time a transaction
enters the transaction pool and was signed from one of the transactions this nodes manages.

methods.name: eth_pendingTransactions
methods.summary:
PendingTransactions returns the transactions that are in the transaction pool
and have a from address that is one of the accounts this node manages.

methods.name: eth_protocolVersion
methods.summary: ProtocolVersion returns the current Ethereum protocol version this node supports

methods.name: eth_resend
methods.summary:
Resend accepts an existing transaction and a new gas price and limit. It will remove
the given transaction from the pool and reinsert it with the new gas price and limit.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_sendRawTransaction
methods.summary:
SendRawTransaction will add the signed transaction to the transaction pool.
The sender is responsible for signing the transaction and using the correct nonce.

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a 256 bit unit of data
oneOf.title: dataWord

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_sendTransaction
methods.summary:
SendTransaction creates a transaction for the given argument, sign it and submit it to the
transaction pool.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_sign
methods.summary:
Sign calculates an ECDSA signature for:
keccack256("\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n" + len(message) + message).

Note, the produced signature conforms to the secp256k1 curve R, S and V values,
where the V value will be 27 or 28 for legacy reasons.

The account associated with addr must be unlocked.

https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_sign

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a 256 bit unit of data
oneOf.title: dataWord

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a 256 bit unit of data
oneOf.title: dataWord

methods.name: eth_signTransaction
methods.summary:
SignTransaction will sign the given transaction with the from account.
The node needs to have the private key of the account corresponding with
the given from address and it needs to be unlocked.

methods.name: eth_submitHashRate
methods.summary:
SubmitHashrate can be used for remote miners to submit their hash rate.
This enables the node to report the combined hash rate of all miners
which submit work through this node.

It accepts the miner hash rate and an identifier which must be unique
between nodes.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_submitWork
methods.summary:
SubmitWork can be used by external miner to submit their POW solution.
It returns an indication if the work was accepted.
Note either an invalid solution, a stale work a non-existent work will return false.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: eth_subscribeSyncStatus
methods.summary:
SubscribeSyncStatus creates a subscription that will broadcast new synchronisation updates.
The given channel must receive interface values, the result can either

methods.name: eth_syncing
methods.summary: Syncing provides information when this nodes starts synchronising with the Ethereum network and when it's finished.

methods.name: eth_syncing
methods.summary:
Syncing returns false in case the node is currently not syncing with the network. It can be up to date or has not
yet received the latest block headers from its pears. In case it is synchronizing:
- startingBlock: block number this node started to synchronise from
- currentBlock:  block number this node is currently importing
- highestBlock:  block number of the highest block header this node has received from peers
- pulledStates:  number of state entries processed until now
- knownStates:   number of known state entries that still need to be pulled

methods.name: eth_uninstallFilter
methods.summary:
UninstallFilter removes the filter with the given filter id.

https://github.com/ethereum/wiki/wiki/JSON-RPC#eth_uninstallfilter

methods.name: ethash_getHashrate
methods.summary: GetHashrate returns the current hashrate for local CPU miner and remote miner.

methods.name: ethash_getWork
methods.summary:
GetWork returns a work package for external miner.

The work package consists of 3 strings:
  result[0] - 32 bytes hex encoded current block header pow-hash
  result[1] - 32 bytes hex encoded seed hash used for DAG
  result[2] - 32 bytes hex encoded boundary condition ("target"), 2^256/difficulty
  result[3] - hex encoded block number

SubmitHashrate can be used for remote miners to submit their hash rate.
This enables the node to report the combined hash rate of all miners
which submit work through this node.

It accepts the miner hash rate and an identifier which must be unique
between nodes.

SubmitWork can be used by external miner to submit their POW solution.
It returns an indication if the work was accepted.

methods.name: miner_getHashrate
methods.summary: GetHashrate returns the current hashrate of the miner.

methods.name: miner_setEtherbase
methods.summary: SetEtherbase sets the etherbase of the miner

methods.name: miner_setExtra
methods.summary: SetExtra sets the extra data string that is included when this miner mines a block.

methods.name: miner_setGasPrice
methods.summary: SetGasPrice sets the minimum accepted gas price for the miner.

methods.name: miner_setRecommitInterval
methods.summary: SetRecommitInterval updates the interval for miner sealing work recommitting.

methods.name: miner_start
methods.summary:
Start starts the miner with the given number of threads. If threads is nil,
the number of workers started is equal to the number of logical CPUs that are
usable by this process. If mining is already running, this method adjust the
number of threads allowed to use and updates the minimum price required by the
transaction pool.

methods.name: miner_stop
methods.summary:
Stop terminates the miner, both at the consensus engine level as well as at
the block creation level.

methods.name: net_listening
methods.summary: Listening returns an indication if the node is listening for network connections.

methods.name: net_peerCount
methods.summary: PeerCount returns the number of connected peers

methods.name: net_version
methods.summary: Version returns the current ethereum protocol version.

methods.name: personal_deriveAccount
methods.summary:
DeriveAccount requests a HD wallet to derive a new account, optionally pinning
it for later reuse.

methods.name: personal_ecRecover
methods.summary:
EcRecover returns the address for the account that was used to create the signature.
Note, this function is compatible with eth_sign and personal_sign. As such it recovers
the address of:
hash = keccak256("\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n"${message length}${message})
addr = ecrecover(hash, signature)

Note, the signature must conform to the secp256k1 curve R, S and V values, where
the V value must be 27 or 28 for legacy reasons.

https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/wiki/Management-APIs#personal_ecRecover

methods.name: personal_importRawKey
methods.summary:
ImportRawKey stores the given hex encoded ECDSA key into the key directory,
encrypting it with the passphrase.

methods.name: personal_initializeWallet
methods.summary: InitializeWallet initializes a new wallet at the provided URL, by generating and returning a new private key.

methods.name: personal_listAccounts
methods.summary: listAccounts will return a list of addresses for accounts this node manages.

methods.name: personal_listWallets
methods.summary: ListWallets will return a list of wallets this node manages.

methods.name: personal_lockAccount
methods.summary: LockAccount will lock the account associated with the given address when it's unlocked.

methods.name: personal_newAccount
methods.summary: NewAccount will create a new account and returns the address for the new account.

methods.name: personal_openWallet
methods.summary:
OpenWallet initiates a hardware wallet opening procedure, establishing a USB
connection and attempting to authenticate via the provided passphrase. Note,
the method may return an extra challenge requiring a second open (e.g. the
Trezor PIN matrix challenge).

methods.name: personal_sendTransaction
methods.summary:
SendTransaction will create a transaction from the given arguments and
tries to sign it with the key associated with args.To. If the given passwd isn't
able to decrypt the key it fails.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: personal_sign
methods.summary:
Sign calculates an Ethereum ECDSA signature for:
keccack256("\x19Ethereum Signed Message:\n" + len(message) + message))

Note, the produced signature conforms to the secp256k1 curve R, S and V values,
where the V value will be 27 or 28 for legacy reasons.

The key used to calculate the signature is decrypted with the given password.

https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/wiki/Management-APIs#personal_sign

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a 256 bit unit of data
oneOf.title: dataWord

oneOf.description: Hex representation of a 256 bit unit of data
oneOf.title: dataWord

methods.name: personal_signAndSendTransaction
methods.summary:
SignAndSendTransaction was renamed to SendTransaction. This method is deprecated
and will be removed in the future. It primary goal is to give clients time to update.

schema.description: Hex representation of a Keccak 256 hash
schema.title: keccak

methods.name: personal_signTransaction
methods.summary:
SignTransaction will create a transaction from the given arguments and
tries to sign it with the key associated with args.To. If the given passwd isn't
able to decrypt the key it fails. The transaction is returned in RLP-form, not broadcast
to other nodes

methods.name: personal_unlockAccount
methods.summary:
UnlockAccount will unlock the account associated with the given address with
the given password for duration seconds. If duration is nil it will use a
default of 300 seconds. It returns an indication if the account was unlocked.

methods.name: personal_unpair
methods.summary: Unpair deletes a pairing between wallet and geth.

methods.name: rpc_modules
methods.summary: Modules returns the list of RPC services with their version number

methods.name: txpool_content
methods.summary: Content returns the transactions contained within the transaction pool.

methods.name: txpool_inspect
methods.summary:
Inspect retrieves the content of the transaction pool and flattens it into an
easily inspectable list.

methods.name: txpool_status
methods.summary: Status returns the number of pending and queued transaction in the pool.

methods.name: web3_clientVersion
methods.summary: ClientVersion returns the node name

methods.name: web3_sha3
methods.summary:
Sha3 applies the ethereum sha3 implementation on the input.
It assumes the input is hex encoded.
